title: Chevron Print Ads (a type of Gothic?)
content:
Hello.

I need to identify the font used in the Chevron 'We Agree' print ads. [http://www.chevron.com/weagree/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258/http:/www.chevron.com/weagree/ "http://www.chevron.com/weagree/") It looks like some kind of Gothic, but I've ruled out Franklin Gothic, Trade Gothic and News Gothic (the G's are wrong).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chevron_6401.png)

Font: 

 Interstate Bold Condensed 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: ihoff

comments.content:
Appears to be Interstate Bold Condensed:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Interstate/styles/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Interstate2_5445.png)

|WE AGREE. DO YOU?| is Interstate Bold:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331051258im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Interstate1_5774.png)

Given that I’m only credited with about half the IDs I make on this board, it’s doubly nice to receive this one.

Thanks for the Laurel and Hardy....
